channel.title: BBC News - Technology
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Amazon targets review firms with legal action
item.description: The tech giant has accused four companies of flooding its shopping sites with fake reviews.

item.title: Facebook accused of deliberately disrupting Australia emergency services
item.description: A whistleblower group claims Facebook allowed a news ban affect vital services to gain leverage.

item.title: UK government sets out plans to rein in Big Tech
item.description: A regulator will have powers to fine firms such as Google and Meta if they fail to follow new rules.

item.title: Gucci stores to accept cryptocurrencies in US
item.description: Gucci joins a growing number of major companies that have started to accept digital currencies.

item.title: Screen-sharing scams on the rise, watchdog warns
item.description: New report claims fraudsters are using screen-sharing tools to gain victims' trust and then steal money.

item.title: Bill Gates on Elon Musk feud and Jeffrey Epstein meetings
item.description: The Microsoft tycoon talks to the BBC about divorce, conspiracy theories and Elon Musk.

item.title: Ukraine war: Investigation finds hundreds of fake charity websites
item.description: A BBC investigation finds online scammers using real charity logos and Ukrainian volunteers' profiles.

item.title: Elon Musk lines up $7bn backing for Twitter deal
item.description: The billionaire has tapped the likes of Oracle's Larry Ellison and Sequoia to finance the takeover.

item.title: Uber loses $5.9bn as Asia investment values fall
item.description: The firm said almost all of that loss was a due to falls in the value of investments in other companies.

item.title: Cyber-security chiefs warn of malicious app risk
item.description: Devices from smart speakers to fitness trackers have apps, and cyber-criminals are exploiting weaknesses.

item.title: Roblox: Gamers frustrated by lengthy outage
item.description: Issues with the game popular with children began before midnight and continued into the morning.

item.title: UK MPs invite Musk to be quizzed on Twitter plans
item.description: It comes amid concerns about the billionaire's plans to relax content moderation rules on the platform.

item.title: Amazon ends Android shopping app digital downloads
item.description: The move is in response to Google's app store policies, under which it takes 30% commission on all sales.

item.title: People can now get contact info cut from Google search results
item.description: The web giant makes it easier to request that results linking to contact information are removed.

item.title: EU accuses Apple of breaking competition law over contactless payments
item.description: The US tech giant denies it is restricting rivals' access to its mobile payments technology.

item.title: Electric hydroplane boat: ‘It feels like we’re flying’
item.description: With the hull out of the water, the craft uses 80% less power than a boat would conventionally need.

item.title: Ukraine war scams: Cybercriminals stole my identity
item.description: Scammers are using emotionally charged tricks in a bid to steal online donations.

item.title: Former Twitter exec questions seriousness of Musk offer
item.description: Vivian Schiller, who used to work there, tells Newsnight Elon Musk enjoys "throwing bombs" on Twitter.

item.title: This plug socket tells you if your energy is green
item.description: A power socket that helps you save electricity and tells you if it's from renewable sources.

item.title: Nano ink solar cells allow tech to charge in any light
item.description: Custom nano inks allow solar cells to be made to any shape and can use ambient light to power devices.

item.title: £5m Virtual Reality centre launches in Portsmouth
item.description: The university centre received more than £3m in government funding to help businesses create VR.

item.title: Why one firm is banking on carbon fibre bikes in Europe
item.description: Europe's bike firms want to source more components closer to home, including carbon fibre frames.

item.title: The perfect storm increasing the cost of a crucial metal
item.description: Nickel is essential for batteries and stainless steel but suppliers are struggling to meet demand.

item.title: Scooter recall hits India's 'Tesla of two-wheelers'
item.description: How a product recall is disrupting one start-up's plans to dominate the electric scooter market.

item.title: Will Taiwan's banks stay stuck in a '1980s' time warp?
item.description: How the pandemic may have jolted an old-fashioned banking industry to make changes.
